metadata.title: CVE-2014-3484 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the __dn_expand function innetwork/dn_expand.c in musl libc 1.1x before 1.1.2 and 0.9.13 through 1.0.3allow remote attackers to (1) have unspecified impact via an invalid namelength in a DNS response or (2) cause a denial of service (crash) via aninvalid name length in a DNS response, related to an infinite loop with nooutput.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3484` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

musl - 0.9.15-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
musl-tools - 0.9.15-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: musl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.15-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
